00041 #define AES_KEYSTORE_VERSION 1L
00042 #define IV_SIZE 16
00043 #define AES_MAX_DIGEST_SIZE 128
00044 
00045 static unsigned char *create_derived_key(const char *key, unsigned int keylength, unsigned char *salt, 
00046                         unsigned int saltlen);
00047 
00048 struct ccn_keystore {
00049     keystore_header header;     // All keystores must begin with this
00050     EVP_PKEY *symmetric_key;
00051     char *digest_algorithm;
00052     ssize_t key_digest_length;
00053     unsigned char key_digest[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH];
00054 };
00055 
00056 static ssize_t
00057 ccn_aes_keystore_key_digest_length(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00058 {
00059     return (p->key_digest_length);
00060 }
00061 
00062 static const unsigned char *
00063 ccn_aes_keystore_key_digest(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00064 {
00065     return (p->key_digest);
00066 }
00067 
00068 static const struct ccn_pkey *
00069 get_key_from_aes_keystore(struct ccn_keystore *ks) 
00070 {
00071     return (struct ccn_pkey *)ks->symmetric_key;
00072 }
00073 
00074 static const char *
00075 ccn_aes_keystore_digest_algorithm(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00076 {
00077     return "HMAC";
00078 }
00079 
00080 static void
00081 ccn_aes_keystore_destroy(struct ccn_keystore **p)
00082 {
00083     if ((*p) != NULL) {
00084         EVP_PKEY_free((*p)->symmetric_key);
00085         free(*p);
00086     }
00087 }
00088 
00089 struct ccn_keystore *
00090 ccn_aes_keystore_create(void)
00091 {
00092     struct ccn_keystore *res = calloc(1, sizeof(*res));
00093     res->header.digest_length_func = ccn_aes_keystore_key_digest_length;
00094     res->header.digest_func = ccn_aes_keystore_key_digest;
00095     res->header.key_func = get_key_from_aes_keystore;
00096     res->header.digest_algorithm_func = ccn_aes_keystore_digest_algorithm;
00097     res->header.destroy_func = ccn_aes_keystore_destroy;
00098     return (res);
00099 }
00100 
00101 static int
00102 ccn_aes_digest(unsigned char *key, unsigned int keylength, unsigned char *key_digest)
00103 {
00104     unsigned int md_len = keylength/8;
00105     int res = 0;
00106     struct ccn_digest *digest;
00107 
00108     memcpy(key_digest, key, keylength/8);
00109     digest = ccn_digest_create(CCN_DIGEST_SHA256);
00110     ccn_digest_init(digest);
00111     res |= ccn_digest_update(digest, key_digest, md_len);
00112     res |= ccn_digest_final(digest, key_digest, md_len);
00113     return res;
00114 }
00115 
00116 int
00117 ccn_aes_keystore_init(struct ccn_keystore *keystore, char *filename, const char *password)
00118 {
00119     FILE *fp = NULL;
00120     AESKeystore_info *ki = NULL;
00121     int ans = -1;
00122     int version;
00123     char oidstr[80];
00124     unsigned char *aes_key;
00125     unsigned char *mac_key;
00126     unsigned char check[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH];
00127     unsigned char *keybuf = NULL;
00128     int check_start;
00129     EVP_CIPHER_CTX ctx;
00130     int length = 0;
00131     int final_length = 0;
00132     int ret;
00133     ASN1_STRING *key_octet;
00134 
00135     OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00136 
00137     fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
00138     if (fp == NULL)
00139         goto Bail;
00140 
00141     ki = d2i_AESKeystore_fp(fp, NULL);
00142     fclose(fp);
00143     if (ki == NULL)
00144         goto Bail;
00145     version = ASN1_INTEGER_get(ki->version);
00146     if (version != AES_KEYSTORE_VERSION)
00147         goto Bail;
00148     OBJ_obj2txt(oidstr, sizeof(oidstr), ki->algorithm_oid, 0);
00149     if (strcasecmp(oidstr, CCN_SIGNING_DEFAULT_DIGEST_ALGORITHM))
00150         goto Bail;
00151     if (ki->encrypted_key->length < IV_SIZE + (SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH * 2) + AES_BLOCK_SIZE)
00152         goto Bail;
00153     
00154     aes_key = create_derived_key(password, strlen(password), (unsigned char *)"\0", 1);
00155     mac_key = create_derived_key(password, strlen(password), (unsigned char *)"\1", 1);
00156     
00157     check_start = ki->encrypted_key->length - SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH;
00158     HMAC(EVP_sha256(), mac_key, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH, ki->encrypted_key->data, check_start, check, NULL);
00159     if (memcmp(&ki->encrypted_key->data[check_start], check, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH))
00160         goto Bail;
00161     keybuf = malloc(SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH + AES_BLOCK_SIZE);
00162     EVP_CIPHER_CTX_init(&ctx);
00163     if (!EVP_DecryptInit(&ctx, EVP_aes_256_cbc(), aes_key, ki->encrypted_key->data))
00164         goto Bail;
00165     if (!EVP_DecryptUpdate(&ctx, keybuf, &length, &ki->encrypted_key->data[IV_SIZE], 
00166                 ki->encrypted_key->length - IV_SIZE - SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH)) {
00167         goto Bail;
00168     }
00169     if (!EVP_DecryptFinal(&ctx, keybuf + length, &final_length))
00170         goto Bail;
00171     if (ccn_aes_digest(keybuf, length * 8, keystore->key_digest))
00172         goto Bail;
00173     keystore->symmetric_key = EVP_PKEY_new();
00174     if (keystore->symmetric_key == NULL)
00175         goto out;
00176     key_octet = ASN1_STRING_new();
00177     ASN1_STRING_set(key_octet, keybuf, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH + AES_BLOCK_SIZE);
00178     ret = ccn_PKEY_assign(keystore->symmetric_key, EVP_PKEY_HMAC, (char *)key_octet);
00179     if (ret == 0)
00180         goto Bail;
00181     ans = 0;
00182     keystore->header.initialized = 1;
00183     keystore->key_digest_length = length;
00184     goto out;
00185 
00186 Bail:
00187     ans = -1;
00188     free(keybuf);
00189     if (keystore->symmetric_key != NULL)
00190         EVP_PKEY_free(keystore->symmetric_key);
00191 out:
00192     return (ans);
00193 }
00194 
00195 /**
00196  * Create an AES keystore file
00197  * @param filename  the name of the keystore file to be created.
00198  * @param password  the import/export password for the keystore.
00199  * @param key       the key to encrypt in the keystore
00200  * @returns 0 on success, -1 on failure
00201  */
00202 int
00203 ccn_aes_keystore_file_init(char *filename, const char *password, unsigned char *key, int keylength)
00204 {
00205     FILE *fp = NULL;
00206     int fd = -1;
00207     int ans = -1;
00208     AESKeystore_info *keystore = NULL;
00209     int nid;
00210     unsigned char *aes_key = NULL;
00211     unsigned char *mac_key = NULL;
00212     EVP_CIPHER_CTX ctx;
00213     unsigned char *encrypted_key = NULL;
00214     unsigned char *p;
00215     int ekl = IV_SIZE + keylength/8 + SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH + AES_BLOCK_SIZE;
00216     int encrypt_length;
00217     struct ccn_digest *digest = NULL;
00218 
00219     OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00220  
00221     if (key == NULL)
00222         goto Bail;
00223     
00224     fd = open(filename, O_CREAT | O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC, 0600);
00225     if (fd == -1)
00226         goto Bail;
00227     fp = fdopen(fd, "wb");
00228     if (fp == NULL)
00229         goto Bail;
00230 
00231     aes_key = create_derived_key(password, strlen(password), (unsigned char *)"\0", 1);
00232     mac_key = create_derived_key(password, strlen(password), (unsigned char *)"\1", 1);
00233     
00234     encrypted_key = malloc(ekl);
00235     if (!encrypted_key)
00236         goto Bail;
00237     RAND_bytes(encrypted_key, IV_SIZE);
00238     EVP_CIPHER_CTX_init(&ctx);
00239     if (!EVP_EncryptInit(&ctx, EVP_aes_256_cbc(), aes_key, encrypted_key))
00240         goto Bail;
00241     p = encrypted_key + IV_SIZE;
00242     if (!EVP_EncryptUpdate(&ctx, p, &encrypt_length, key, keylength/8))
00243         goto Bail; 
00244     p += encrypt_length;
00245     if (!EVP_EncryptFinal(&ctx, p, &encrypt_length))
00246         goto Bail;
00247     p += encrypt_length;
00248     HMAC(EVP_sha256(), mac_key, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH, encrypted_key, p - encrypted_key, p, NULL);
00249 
00250     if (!(keystore = AESKeystore_info_new()))
00251         goto Bail;
00252     if (!(keystore->version = ASN1_INTEGER_new()))
00253         goto Bail;
00254     if (!ASN1_INTEGER_set(keystore->version, AES_KEYSTORE_VERSION))
00255         goto Bail;
00256     keystore->algorithm_oid = OBJ_txt2obj(CCN_SIGNING_DEFAULT_DIGEST_ALGORITHM, 0);
00257     nid = OBJ_obj2nid(keystore->algorithm_oid);
00258     if (nid == NID_undef)
00259         goto Bail;      // Shouldn't happen now but could later if we support more algorithms
00260     if (!ASN1_OCTET_STRING_set(keystore->encrypted_key, encrypted_key, ekl))
00261         goto Bail;
00262     i2d_AESKeystore_fp(fp, keystore);
00263     ans = 0;
00264     goto cleanup;
00265     
00266 Bail:
00267     ans = -1;
00268 cleanup:
00269     ccn_digest_destroy(&digest);
00270     if (fp != NULL)
00271         fclose(fp);
00272     if (encrypted_key)
00273         free(encrypted_key);
00274     if (keystore) {
00275         AESKeystore_info_free(keystore);
00276     }
00277     if (fd != -1)
00278         close(fd);
00279     return (ans);
00280 }
00281 
00282 void
00283 ccn_generate_symmetric_key(unsigned char *keybuf, int keylength) 
00284 {
00285     RAND_bytes(keybuf, keylength/8);
00286 }
00287 
00288 /* 
00289  * Create the filename based on SHA256 digest of the key 
00290  * keylength is bit length
00291  */
00292 int 
00293 ccn_create_aes_filename_from_key(struct ccn_charbuf *filename, unsigned char *key, int keylength) 
00294 {
00295     unsigned char md_value[keylength/8];
00296     int res = 0;
00297 
00298     res = ccn_aes_digest(key, keylength, md_value);
00299     if (res < 0) 
00300         return 0;
00301     ccn_create_filename_with_digest_suffix(filename, md_value, keylength/8);
00302     return 1;
00303 }
00304 
00305 void
00306 ccn_create_filename_with_digest_suffix(struct ccn_charbuf *filename, const unsigned char *digest, int digest_len)
00307 {
00308     int i;
00309 
00310     ccn_charbuf_append_string(filename, "-");
00311     for (i = 0; i < digest_len; i++) {
00312         ccn_charbuf_putf(filename, "%02X", digest[i]);
00313     }
00314 }
00315 
00316 static unsigned char *
00317 create_derived_key(const char *key, unsigned int keylength, unsigned char *salt, 
00318                         unsigned int saltlen) 
00319 {
00320     unsigned char *ans = malloc(SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00321     HMAC(EVP_sha256(), key, keylength, salt, saltlen, ans, NULL);
00322     return ans;
00323 }
